<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 123, 637, 146]]<|/det|> # Cambridge International AS & A Level <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 185]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NAME <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 220, 165, 235]]<|/det|> CENTRE NUMBER <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 213, 424, 259]]<|/det|>
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[891, 183, 949, 195]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[47, 201, 80, 228]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 219, 165, 235]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[512, 219, 722, 235]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[724, 213, 756, 239]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[778, 219, 890, 239]]<|/det|> <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 277, 322, 292]]<|/det|> # FURTHER MATHEMATICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[827, 279, 905, 294]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 302, 366, 317]]<|/det|> Paper 1 Further Pure Mathematics 1 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[850, 328, 907, 342]]<|/det|> 2 hours <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 391, 399]]<|/det|> You will need: List of formulae (MF19) <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 419, 222, 432]]<|/det|> ## INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 291, 450]]<|/det|> - Answer all questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 451, 761, 466]]<|/det|> - Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 481]]<|/det|> - Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 481, 565, 496]]<|/det|> - Write your answer to each question in the space provided. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 497, 478, 512]]<|/det|> - Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 358, 528]]<|/det|> - Do not write on any bar codes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 529, 867, 545]]<|/det|> - If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 482, 575]]<|/det|> - You should use a calculator where appropriate. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 881, 591]]<|/det|> - You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 605, 854, 620]]<|/det|> - Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 669, 214, 680]]<|/det|> # INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 683, 388, 698]]<|/det|> - The total mark for this paper is 75 . <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 730, 714]]<|/det|> - The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 678, 91]]<|/det|>
1 (a) Use standard results from the list of formulae (MF19) to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[350, 107, 649, 153]]<|/det|>
\[
\sum_{r=1}^{n}(2-3 r)(5-3 r)=a n^{3}+b n^{2}+c n
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 166, 521, 183]]<|/det|>
where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 76, 714, 118]]<|/det|>
(b) Use the method of differences to find \(\sum_{r=1}^{n} \frac{1}{(2-3 r)(5-3 r)}\) in terms of \(n\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 816, 479, 858]]<|/det|>
(c) Deduce the value of \(\sum_{r=1}^{\infty} \frac{1}{(2-3 r)(5-3 r)}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 532, 97]]<|/det|>
2 The cubic equation \(x^{3}+2 x+1=0\) has roots \(\alpha, \beta, \gamma\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 106, 631, 127]]<|/det|>
(a) Find a cubic equation whose roots are \(\alpha^{3}-1, \beta^{3}-1, \gamma^{3}-1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 76, 545, 101]]<|/det|>
（b）Find the value of \(\left(\alpha^{3}-1\right)^{2}+\left(\beta^{3}-1\right)^{2}+\left(\gamma^{3}-1\right)^{2}\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 516, 545, 542]]<|/det|>
（c）Find the value of \(\left(\alpha^{3}-1\right)^{3}+\left(\beta^{3}-1\right)^{3}+\left(\gamma^{3}-1\right)^{3}\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 736, 95]]<|/det|>
3 The sequence \(u_{1}, u_{2}, u_{3}, \ldots\) is such that \(u_{1}=5\) and \(u_{n+1}=6 u_{n}+5\) for \(n \geqslant 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 105, 637, 126]]<|/det|>
(a) Prove by induction that \(u_{n}=6^{n}-1\) for all positive integers \(n\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 835, 504, 854]]<|/det|>
(b) Deduce that \(u_{2 n}\) is divisible by \(u_{n}\) for \(n \geqslant 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 74, 565, 89]]<|/det|>
BLANK PAGE

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 692, 112]]<|/det|>
4 The matrix \(\mathbf{M}\) is given by \(\mathbf{M}=\left(\begin{array}{ll}1 & 2 \\ 0 & 1\end{array}\right)\left(\begin{array}{rr}\cos \theta & -\sin \theta \\ \sin \theta & \cos \theta\end{array}\right)\) ，where \(0<\theta<2 \pi\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 127, 849, 146]]<|/det|>
（a）The matrix \(\mathbf{M}\) represents a sequence of two geometrical transformations in the \(x-y\) plane．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 158, 852, 176]]<|/det|>
State the type of each transformation，and make clear the order in which they are applied．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 558, 915, 578]]<|/det|>
（b）Find the value of \(\theta\) for which the transformation represented by \(\mathbf{M}\) has a line of invariant points．［7］

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 570, 99]]<|/det|>
5 The curve \(C\) has polar equation \(r=\theta \mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{8} \theta}\), for \(0 \leqslant \theta \leqslant 2 \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 111, 236, 129]]<|/det|>
(a) Sketch \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 404, 921, 425]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the area of the region bounded by \(C\) and the initial line, giving your answer in the form \(\left(p \pi^{2}+q \pi+r\right) \mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{2} \pi}+s\), where \(p, q, r\) and \(s\) are integers to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 242, 598, 262]]<|/det|>
(c) Show that, at the point of \(C\) furthest from the initial line,

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 264, 605, 300]]<|/det|>
\[
\theta \cos \theta+\left(\frac{1}{8} \theta+1\right) \sin \theta=0
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 304, 617, 323]]<|/det|>
and verify that this equation has a root between 5 and 5.05.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 435, 91]]<|/det|>
6 The points \(A, B, C\) have position vectors

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[372, 103, 625, 124]]<|/det|>
\[
\mathbf{i}-2 \mathbf{k}, \quad \mathbf{i}+2 \mathbf{j}+2 \mathbf{k}, \quad 2 \mathbf{i}-\mathbf{j}-\mathbf{k}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 136, 220, 153]]<|/det|>
respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 166, 823, 183]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the equation of the plane \(A B C\), giving your answer in the form \(a x+b y+c z=d\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 536, 515, 553]]<|/det|>
A point \(D\) has position vector \(\mathbf{i}+t \mathbf{k}\), where \(t \neq-2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 567, 590, 585]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the acute angle between the planes \(A B C\) and \(A B D\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 75, 830, 95]]<|/det|>
(c) Find the values of \(t\) such that the shortest distance between the lines \(A B\) and \(C D\) is \(\sqrt{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 461, 111]]<|/det|>
7 The curve \(C\) has equation \(y=\frac{2 x^{2}-5 x}{2 x^{2}-7 x-4}\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 123, 489, 142]]<|/det|>
（a）Find the equations of the asymptotes of \(C\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 370, 554, 387]]<|/det|>
（b）Find the coordinates of any stationary points on \(C\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 74, 678, 91]]<|/det|>
(c) Sketch \(C\), stating the coordinates of the intersections with the axes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 555, 550, 595]]<|/det|>
(d) Sketch the curve with equation \(y=\left|\frac{2 x^{2}-5 x}{2 x^{2}-7 x-4}\right|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 76, 703, 115]]<|/det|>
(e) Find in exact form the set of values of \(x\) for which \(\left|\frac{2 x^{2}-5 x}{2 x^{2}-7 x-4}\right|<\frac{1}{9}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 105, 918, 122]]<|/det|>
If you use the following lined page to complete the answer(s) to any question(s), the question number(s) must be clearly shown.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[436, 74, 562, 89]]<|/det|>
BLANK PAGE
